image.altText: Sandstone buildings on street.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man is dead following an alleged stabbing in Hobart's Salamanca precinct.

title.children: Man dies in alleged stabbing near Hobart's Salamanca Place

image.altText: Man sits on chair with gold framed painting in background

props.synopsis: Eric Abetz's first budget for Tasmania is coming — and community organisations fear they'll bear the brunt of funding cuts to "repair" the budget.

title.children: Abetz's cost-cutting priorities spark concerns for community organisations

image.altText: A man holds a surfboard covered in sea creatures.

props.synopsis: A barnacle-covered surfboard that spent 17 months at sea and travelled from Tasmania to New Zealand after it was lost off a boat appears set to be reunited with its owner.

title.children: Social media helps solve lost and found surfboard mystery

image.altText: Generic photos of a mental health facility.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC show a failed audit at Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health facility, claims that staff concerns were ignored, and the lead-up to the departure of its CEO.

title.children: 'The board were warned': Hobart Clinic staff concerned for years

image.altText: Bird spreads its wings while in water.

props.synopsis: With migratory birds returning to Tasmania during a period of increased bird flu, the chance of the virus affecting the state's coastal areas is on the rise.

title.children: Spring's migratory flocks pose bird flu risk for Tasmania

image.altText: Elke King outside the emergency department.

props.synopsis: Staff at Tasmania's public hospital emergency departments say they experience violence and aggression "all the time". Data released under right to information laws shows how often these incidents are occurring.

title.children: Public hospital staff struggle to return full-time amid assaults and PTSD

image.altText: Black and white photo of 1920s actress Louise Lovely

props.synopsis: Australia's first Hollywood star, a famous romance novel by Joh Bjelke-Petersen's aunt and a rare alloy mined from Tasmania's west coast put the island's wild places on the big screen.

title.children: The story behind the lost film that marked a career end for our first Hollywood star

image.altText: Kathryn looks out the window of her tiny house with a vexed expression.

props.synopsis: A tiny home which began as a dream for Kathryn Payne becomes little more than a $130,000 storage unit in her dad's front yard as a local council in Perth's north demands the structure be removed.

title.children: 'Absolutely horrendous': Tiny home in limbo as council demands removal

image.altText: A close up of Prince Andrew looking over his shoulder and wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The Prince Andrew debacle is shameful for the monarchy — it's not a pile-on, it's alleged paedophilia. So should the royals do more, here?

title.children: A system of secrecy has long protected powerful men like Prince Andrew

image.altText: Two men in suits walking.

props.synopsis: The prime minister batted away concerns over Kevin Rudd's future after Donald Trump said he does not forget when people "say bad" things about him.

title.children: Albanese dismisses lingering questions about Trump and Rudd

image.altText: Smart bot sex dolls Chinese factory

props.synopsis: Child sexual abuse doll heads are being sold on Temu as hairdressing model mannequins to harness a legal loophole, according to experts who say it is part of an "unhealthy culture".

title.children: Child sex dolls sold without heads to harness loophole

image.altText: Matt Canavan holds a lump of coal.

props.synopsis: Nationals Senator Matt Canavan will present parts of his and Ross Cadell's net zero review to the party room when parliament resumes on Monday.

title.children: Nationals' net zero review has not undertaken economic modelling

image.altText: Jess Sergis scores a try for the Jillaroos against Fetu Samoa.

props.synopsis: The Jillaroos show why they are world champions, recording a dominant 60-0 victory over Fetū Sāmoa in Brisbane.

title.children: Jillaroos thump Fetū Sāmoa in Pacific Championships Test

image.altText: Hail in backyard

props.synopsis: South-east Queensland's energy network was "absolutely smashed" as severe thunderstorms brought large hail and strong winds.

title.children: Large hail, 96kph wind gusts as severe storm hits south-east Queensland

image.altText: A property after being damaged by a storm

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of Victorians were left without power and a tornado swept through Melbourne's west on a wild day of weather.

title.children: Tornado hits Melbourne, cutting power to thousands

image.altText: Min Aung Hlaing

props.synopsis: Instead of talking about Myanmar, the US president and his regional counterparts will be congratulating themselves for helping Thailand and Cambodia strike a peace deal.

title.children: 'Lack of unity': Myanmar haunts ASEAN summit

image.altText: A man wearing a mask and holding a stick stands over a woman lying on the ground.

props.synopsis: Settler violence against Palestinians in the West Bank ramps up every year during olive harvest, but a brazen attack caught on camera has left the community shaken.

title.children: West Bank community left reeling after Palestinian clubbed by masked Israeli settler

image.altText: A man in a crowd reaches out his hands.

props.synopsis: If Zohran Mamdani wins, he will become New York's first Muslim and millennial mayor. It's something his campaign has been acutely aware of as he taps into new voting bases.

title.children: 'Zohranastrians' have taken over NYC. It could be the city's turning point

image.altText: A man holding two letters in front of a post box

props.synopsis: From feeling "harassed" to fraudulent activity, this is what you had to say about how receiving mail that is not yours has impacted your life.

title.children: Readers share their experiences of receiving other people's mail

image.altText: Former U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris speaks during a gala in San Francisco

props.synopsis: The former US vice-president won't commit to making another bid for the White House yet, but reiterates she's "not done" with public service.

title.children: Kamala Harris hints she may run for US presidency again

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in a blue suit and white shirt speaking to someone out of frame.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he plans to hike tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10 per cent because of an anti-tariff television ad aired by the province of Ontario.

title.children: Trump punishes Canada with 10pc tariff increase over TV ad stoush

image.altText: A mother sits on the couch smiling with her two twins on her knees

props.synopsis: The international surrogacy market attracts hundreds of Australians each year, but one country in particular has become a top destination for people wishing to start their families.

title.children: Hundreds of Australians are heading to Russia's doorstep to have babies

image.altText: emergency services helping extricate man from truck in bushland

props.synopsis: A man, believed to be in his 50s, was trapped for more than six hours after his truck rolled west of Cessnock in the NSW Hunter Valley.

title.children: Man freed after truck rollover spills 20,000 litres of seafood liquid product

image.altText: A boy in a blue jumper and work boots sits on a bale of hay on the bed of an old, olive-green ute.

props.synopsis: After-school restoration fun wins 11-year-old Wheatbelt mini-mechanic Harry Strange best in show.

title.children: Restoring a 1970s ute was this 11-year-old's passion project

image.altText: A group of AFLW players in white and blue celebrate a win.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne equals the VFL/AFL record for consecutive wins and claims the AFLW minor premiership with a 46-point drubbing of St Kilda.

title.children: AFLW minor premier North equals historic winning streak as lightning wreaks havoc

image.altText: Esther looks sadly out her bedroom window.

props.synopsis: They started high school as the world went into lockdown, interrupting their young lives at a pivotal moment. Now they’re graduating year 12 and figuring out what to do next.

title.children: 'Lost that side of myself': Generation pandemic set to face Year 12 exams

image.altText: An older woman pats a Lassie dog

props.synopsis: Lockhart died on Thursday of natural causes at her home in Santa Monica, a family spokesperson says.

title.children: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure from Lassie and Lost In Space, dies aged 100

image.altText: A crowd raise their fists to the sky.

props.synopsis: It's been 20 years since violence erupted on the streets of Cronulla after thousands gathered in a public display to "reclaim their beach" from specific migrant communities. So, what has changed?

title.children: 'We've got to stop pretending': What we learnt 20 years on from the Cronulla Riots

image.altText: Forensic police outside red brick unit that's cordoned off

props.synopsis: A 56-year-old man is charged with murder over the death of a woman in Western Australia's far north.

title.children: Man charged with murder of woman, 58, in WA's north

image.altText: GettyImages-1308071351

props.synopsis: Two years after she took out a domestic violence order against her ex-partner, Aurora realised he was working 10m from her reserved seat at the Gabba — she believes he accessed her details by calling the club’s membership line.

title.children: Two phone calls confirm footy fan's suspicion about how ex tracked her down

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: We both know you're hoping for the best with this week's quiz. Just remember, hope will get you nowhere.

title.children: Convinced your losing streak is finally over? Prove it. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: Close up of bananas.

props.synopsis: Australia's first genetically modified banana has been tweaked to protect it from a disease that's on the verge of wiping out crops around the world. Researchers hope it may be on our shelves by 2027.

title.children: Could an Australian banana prevent a global crop collapse?

image.altText: illustration of a faceless woman, looking back with a bouquet. around her logos of social media platforms, smartphones in fists

props.synopsis: Gen Zs in several Asian countries launch an online war against political "nepo babies" who flaunt their wealth on social media.

title.children: In some countries 'wealth flaunting' was aspirational. Now gen Z are calling it out

image.altText: two police cars with lihts on parked in a street with police tape around

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a suspected machete brawl after a 19-year-old man was found with serious injuries.

title.children: Man seriously injured in suspected machete brawl in Melbourne's north

image.altText: Stumps of ancient trees stick out of the sand near the shoreline

props.synopsis: Harsh winter weather has exposed almost 100 preserved trees from an ancient wetland on an Esperance beach, but there are fears over protecting the site on a popular four-wheel drive stretch.

title.children: Ancient wetland older than Egypt's pyramids exposed on beach
